data.title: Pulmonary, Critical Care & Sleep Medicine Fellows
data.meta_description: Meet Ohio State's Pulmonary, Critical Care and Sleep Medicine fellows.
data.text:
Michelle Gillespie, MD

Hometown: Needham, MA

Undergraduate: College of William and Mary

Medical School: University of Massachusetts

Residency: The Ohio State University and Nationwide Children's Hospital

About me: I am doing a combined fellowship in adult pulmonary/critical care and pediatric pulmonary medicine. My clinical and research interests are in transitions of care from pediatric to adult medicine, including pulmonary complications of sickle cell disease, cystic fibrosis, lung transplant, and rare lung diseases. I am also passionate about critical care medicine, medical education, and physician wellness. Outside of work, I enjoy playing soccer, running, baking, needlepointing, watching Disney movies, using tiny spoons to eat ice cream, reading, and supporting Boston sports teams - go Pats!

Tyler Haddad, DO

Hometown: Longmeadow, MA

Undergraduate: Wake Forest University

Medical School: University of New England

Residency: The Ohio State University

About me: My research and clinical interests include pulmonary toxicities of cancer treatments, hyperoxia in the intensive care unit, interstitial lung disease, and global health. I am an avid traveler and has enjoyed time in over 20 countries. I love exploring new places and foods with my wife, sailing, hiking, live music, and Boston sports teams.

Michael Koenig, MD

Hometown: Charlottesville, VA

Undergraduate: University of Virginia

Medical School: University of Kentucky

Residency: Vanderbilt University

About me: I have played the drums since I was five years old and in college I was a member of the Percussion Ensemble, Wind Ensemble, and University of Virginia Drumline, where I was Quad Section Leader. Before I graduated from college, my parents moved to Morehead, Kentucky, where they currently reside. I attended the University of Kentucky College of Medicine where I realized a lifelong dream of working with and being taught by my father, a Pulmonary and Critical Care physician. I moved to Nashville, Tennessee, to complete a residency in Internal Medicine at Vanderbilt University. While a resident, I performed a secondary analysis of The Isotonic Solutions and Major Adverse Renal Events Trial, which compared Lactated Ringerâ€™s versus saline among critically ill adults with cirrhosis. My other interests include playing tennis, golf, UVA basketball and traveling. I am excited to start fellowship training and get to know Ohio State and the city of Columbus better.

Patrick Kramer, MD

Hometown: Akron, OH

Undergraduate: University of Notre Dame

Medical School: Loyola University Chicago

Residency: Case Western Reserve University

About me: I have spent time as an academic hospitalist at the Cleveland VA Medical Center and previously completed a Fulbright research grant in Singapore. Career interests include diagnostic reasoning, sarcoidosis, and adult learning strategies within medical education. I love cheering on the Buckeyes, and I also enjoy brewing coffee and playing disc golf. You can find me exploring the outdoors or findings new restaurants with my wife in my free time.

Ayal Levi, MD

Hometown: Victoria, BC, Canada

Undergraduate: University of Victoria

Medical School: Ben-Gurion University, Israel

Residency: National Jewish-Saint Joseph Hospital, Denver

About me: My clinical interests are in ARDs, hypoxia-induced lung injury, and outpatient monitoring with biosensors. I am also passionate about education (not only my own). When not in the hospital, I love spending time with my wife, two children, and occasionally lifting a weight or two.

Sarah MacDowell, MD

Hometown: Cincinnati, OH

Undergraduate: Knox College

Medical School: George Washington University

Residency: The Ohio State University and Nationwide Children's Hospital

About me: From a medical education perspective, I am interested in curriculum development, assessment methods, and learning technology. From a clinical and research perspective I am interested in caregiver burden, post-ICU care, respiratory failure in neuromuscular conditions, and transitions of care from pediatric to adult care. Outside of work I enjoy exploring the Columbus park system with my husband and our dog Wanda, swimming, making coffee, and going to breweries.

Katie Adib, MD

Hometown: Dayton, Ohio

Undergraduate: The Ohio State University

Medical School: Wright State University, Boonshoft School of Medicine

Residency: The Ohio State University

About me: My clinical interests are pulmonary hypertension, ILD, and sarcoid and I am excited to get to get experience in all these areas during fellowship. I also have a passion for medical education and DEI implementing new simulation sessions and further developing the IM residency DEI curriculum. In my free time, I enjoy going on long walks with the cutest pup ever, Charlie, long bike rides to farmers markets, and going to new restaurants and breweries around town. I am also is an avid music lover and frequent the concert scene in Columbus and surrounding cities.

Tejas Sinha, MD

Hometown: Columbus, OH

Undergraduate: The Ohio State University

Medical School: The Ohio State University

Residency: The Ohio State University

About me: I travelled east to Philadelphia for my general pulmonary and critical care training at Temple University Hospital. While at Temple, my interests in advanced bronchoscopy and interventional pulmonary grew as I was exposed to a robust lung transplant and bronchoscopic lung volume reduction program. I returned to Ohio State to train with world class faculty and gain expertise in diagnostic and therapeutic interventional pulmonary procedures for benign and malignant processes. In my free time, I like to watch football (Go Bucks! Go Birds!) and explore the outdoors with my wife, son and german shepherd.

Sarah Knapp

Hometown: Orlando, FL

Undergraduate: University of FloridaMedical School: West Virginia University School of MedicineResidency: Medical University of South Carolina

About me: I completed my Pulmonary & Critical Care Fellowship at the Medical University of South Carolina and I am completing my Sleep Medicine Fellowship with OSUMC. In my free time, I enjoy spending time with my husband, son, and dog. I also enjoy cooking, reading and cheering on the Florida Gators.

Kimberly Van Dongen

Hometown: Martinsburg, WV

Medical School: Edward Via College of Osteopathic Medicine

Residency: MetroHealth

About me: I grew up in Martinsburg, West Virginia. I completed my B.S. in Biochemistry at Virginia Tech and then stayed in Blacksburg, VA for medical school at the Edward Via College of Osteopathic Medicine. I went on to complete my residency in Internal Medicine at MetroHealth in Cleveland, OH before coming down to Columbus for sleep medicine fellowship at OSU. In my free time, I enjoy exploring the city with my husband on our eBikes, going on culinary adventures, cooking, kayaking, and traveling to new places.
